meanings.definition: A type of particle accelerator that uses electromagnetic fields to accelerate charged particles to high speeds.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study synchrotrons to learn about speeding up particles.
meanings.sent2: The synchrotrons at the lab help researchers understand particle acceleration.
meanings.sent3: Why did the charged particles throw a party in the synchrotron? They wanted to speed up the fun!
meanings.sent4: The synchrotrons hum with energy, like a bustling city street at rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The synchrotrons whirred and whizzed, propelling particles forward at incredible speeds.

meanings.definition: A facility that houses a synchrotron accelerator for scientific research.
meanings.sent1: The new synchrotrons building will host advanced particle research.
meanings.sent2: Scientists from around the world visit the synchrotrons for experiments.
meanings.sent3: Why did the researcher bring a ladder to the synchrotrons? To reach new heights in science!
meanings.sent4: The synchrotrons facility is a hive of activity, buzzing with innovation.
meanings.sent5: Inside the synchrotrons, discoveries spark and illuminate the path to new knowledge.

meanings.definition: The process of synchronizing the movement of particles in a synchrotron accelerator.
meanings.sent1: The technician ensures the synchrotrons' synchronization for optimal performance.
meanings.sent2: Synchronizing particle movement is crucial for the efficiency of synchrotrons.
meanings.sent3: Why did the particles organize a dance-off in the synchrotrons? To see who could move in perfect sync!
meanings.sent4: In the synchrotrons, particles dance together in harmony like a synchronized swimming team.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized dance of particles in the synchrotrons creates a mesmerizing display of physics in action.
